articles.headline: Debate on Bourbon St.: Should the Good Times Roll Less Loudly?
articles.snippet: When the efforts to fix a faulty and spottily enforced noise ordinance became bogged down, the New Orleans City Council decided to try to fix what is perhaps the country’s pre-eminent 24-hour street party.
articles.abstract: When the efforts to fix a faulty and spottily enforced noise ordinance became bogged down, the New Orleans City Council decided to try to fix what is perhaps the country’s pre-eminent 24-hour street party.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW ORLEANS — Last Thursday, two nights after Mardi Gras, amid the customary debauchery that is apparently immune to the chill and the Lenten hangover, a tall man with a device resembling a 1980s-era cellphone was going door to door on Bourbon Street.

articles.headline: F.T.C. Inquiry Into Herbalife Prompts Big Share Selloff
articles.snippet: Shares of Herbalife tumble after the company says it has received a civil investigative demand from the Federal Trade Commission.
articles.abstract: Shares of Herbalife tumble after the company says it has received a civil investigative demand from the Federal Trade Commission.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Federal Trade Commission said on Wednesday that it had opened an official inquiry into Herbalife, the nutritional supplement company that has been the focus of a 15-month crusade by the hedge fund billionaire William A. Ackman.
articles.byline: By Alexandra Stevenson and Peter Eavis

articles.headline: A Wild Idea: Making Our Smartphones Last Longer
articles.snippet: Saving money and global resources are just two good reasons not to ditch your cellphone after the traditional two-year cycle.
articles.abstract: Saving money and global resources are just two good reasons not to ditch your cellphone after the traditional two-year cycle.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Apple unveiled the iPhone 5 late in 2012, it was the fastest and most capable smartphone on the market, a highly intricate collection of electronics that had been miraculously forged into a single sturdy slab of aluminum and glass. Unlike most ephemeral gadgets, this phone felt as if it were built to last for ages.

articles.headline: Huge Recall by G.M. Sets Off Painful Questions on Crashes
articles.snippet: Families face new feelings of grief and anger over possibly missed warnings of problems with the vehicles’ ignition switches.
articles.abstract: Families face new feelings of grief and anger over possibly missed warnings of problems with the vehicles’ ignition switches.
articles.lead_paragraph: LEXINGTON, Ala. — The broken windshield and singed grass that have been on the side of State Route 64 since December serve as a daily reminder for the unsettling hunch that nags Steve W. Smith: Something about that accident was not quite right.

articles.headline: The Gray Jobs Enigma
articles.snippet: Though the number of people working while retired has risen in 20 years, more people give up on the idea, largely because of the difficulty in finding a suitable job.
articles.abstract: Though the number of people working while retired has risen in 20 years, more people give up on the idea, largely because of the difficulty in finding a suitable job.
articles.lead_paragraph: In her years as a probation officer north of Dallas, Patricia Lowell reckoned that she would work until age 65, confident that she could then retire halfway comfortably on her pension and Social Security. After retiring, she thought, she would pick up some extra spending money by working part-time retail jobs during the holiday season.

articles.headline: The Science of Older and Wiser
articles.snippet: The definition of wisdom may be hard to pin down precisely, but for those who have it, aging will be a pleasure.
articles.abstract: The definition of wisdom may be hard to pin down precisely, but for those who have it, aging will be a pleasure.
articles.lead_paragraph: Since ancient times, the elusive concept of wisdom has figured prominently in philosophical and religious texts. The question remains compelling: What is wisdom, and how does it play out in individual lives? Most psychologists agree that if you define wisdom as maintaining positive well-being and kindness in the face of challenges, it is one of the most important qualities one can possess to age successfully — and to face physical decline and death.

articles.headline: Theories Grow Without Facts on Lost Flight
articles.snippet: On news programs and in chat rooms, aviation experts and the less informed tried to explain how a modern jet like Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 could disappear without a trace.
articles.abstract: On news programs and in chat rooms, aviation experts and the less informed tried to explain how a modern jet like Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 could disappear without a trace.
articles.lead_paragraph: It is the talk of lunchrooms, chat rooms and, most certainly, television green rooms across the globe: How and why could a modern passenger jet disappear without a trace?

articles.headline: Regulators Size Up Wall Street, With Worry
articles.snippet: Bank regulators are using the bully pulpit to make sweeping, critical pronouncements about the ethos of the industry that they monitor.
articles.abstract: Bank regulators are using the bully pulpit to make sweeping, critical pronouncements about the ethos of the industry that they monitor.
articles.lead_paragraph: Money laundering, market rigging, tax dodging, selling faulty financial products, trampling homeowner rights and rampant risk-taking — these are some of the sins that big banks have committed in recent years.

articles.headline: F.D.A. Panel Recommends Replacement for the Pap Test
articles.snippet: The panel recommended that a test made by Roche be the primary means of detecting human papilloma virus, which causes almost all cervical cancer.
articles.abstract: The panel recommended that a test made by Roche be the primary means of detecting human papilloma virus, which causes almost all cervical cancer.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Pap test, a ritual for women that has been the mainstay of cervical cancer prevention for 60 years, may be about to play a less crucial role.

articles.headline: Lawyers Prepare for G.M. Suits With Novel Strategies
articles.snippet: Lawyers claim they are receiving many phone calls from potential litigants over faulty car ignition switches.
articles.abstract: Lawyers claim they are receiving many phone calls from potential litigants over faulty car ignition switches.
articles.lead_paragraph: Ever since General Motors announced the recall of 1.6 million vehicles because of a faulty ignition switch, lawyers across the country have been preparing to sue the automaker.

articles.headline: How a Military Sexual Assault Case Foundered
articles.snippet: The prosecution of Brig. Gen. Jeffrey A. Sinclair came apart Monday, and questions about the credibility of his accuser may have sowed doubts months earlier.
articles.abstract: The prosecution of Brig. Gen. Jeffrey A. Sinclair came apart Monday, and questions about the credibility of his accuser may have sowed doubts months earlier.
articles.lead_paragraph: FORT BRAGG, N.C. — The most important sexual assault prosecution in the military came apart on Monday. But cracks had appeared two months earlier in the same North Carolina military courtroom.
articles.byline: By Alan Blinder and Richard A. Oppel Jr

articles.headline: G.M. Reveals It Was Told of Ignition Defect in ’01
articles.snippet: General Motors said on Wednesday that it had received reports of a safety defect in its cars as early as 2001 — three years earlier than previously disclosed.
articles.abstract: General Motors said on Wednesday that it had received reports of a safety defect in its cars as early as 2001 — three years earlier than previously disclosed.
articles.lead_paragraph: General Motors said on Wednesday that it had received reports as early as 2001 — three years earlier than previously disclosed — of a safety defect in its cars that the company has now linked to 12 deaths and at least 31 accidents over the past decade.

articles.headline: Jet Hunt Shifts as Findings Hint at Longer Flight
articles.snippet: Experts were poring over military radar data that seemed to indicate that the missing Malaysian flight had turned west and stayed aloft long after its last contact with ground controllers.
articles.abstract: Experts were poring over military radar data that seemed to indicate that the missing Malaysian flight had turned west and stayed aloft long after its last contact with ground controllers.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Investigators are examining data that appear to show that the missing Malaysia Airlines jetliner was still in automated communication with satellite systems, and may therefore still have been airborne or at least functional, for hours after ground controllers last heard from it, a well-placed official involved in the investigation said on Thursday.
articles.byline: By Matthew L. Wald and Thomas Fuller

articles.headline: U.S. Criticized for Lack of Action on Mortgage Fraud
articles.snippet: The Justice Department has repeatedly and significantly overstated its efforts to prosecute mortgage fraud, an internal watchdog said on Thursday in a report that cited the department’s “disturbing” inability to verify its information.
articles.abstract: The Justice Department has repeatedly and significantly overstated its efforts to prosecute mortgage fraud, an internal watchdog said on Thursday in a report that cited the department’s “disturbing” inability to verify its information.

articles.headline: Russian Troops Mass at Border With Ukraine
articles.snippet: Russia’s troop buildup raised alarms about a possible invasion and drew a sharp rebuke from Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany, who said Russia faced diplomatic and economic retaliation.
articles.abstract: Russia’s troop buildup raised alarms about a possible invasion and drew a sharp rebuke from Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany, who said Russia faced diplomatic and economic retaliation.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — With a referendum on secession looming in Crimea, Russia massed troops and armored vehicles in at least three regions along Ukraine’s eastern border on Thursday, alarming the interim Ukraine government about a possible invasion and significantly escalating tensions in the crisis between the Kremlin and the West.
articles.byline: By Steven Lee Myers and Alison Smale

articles.headline: A Blueprint for Ukraine
articles.snippet: Ukrainian business executives say Western aid may prove a Band-Aid unless Kiev faces its structural challenges and sheds its communist past, like Poland did decades ago.
articles.abstract: Ukrainian business executives say Western aid may prove a Band-Aid unless Kiev faces its structural challenges and sheds its communist past, like Poland did decades ago.
articles.lead_paragraph: LVIV, Ukraine — Every kind of business in this restless pro-European stronghold near the border with Poland has an idea about how to make Ukraine like its more prosperous neighbor.
